And for those who can't see Jerome either:

Gosh it's been quiet here lately.

Since the keyboard layout poll, I've set up some SCIM tables so that one can type using Peter Guiness' layout, and get QS text in either the Unicode Private Use Area (as used by Paul Tremblay's ThothUni font) or in the Jerome or King Plus fonts.  If anyone is at all interested, I'll put the tables up in the files area.

SCIM (Smart Common/Chinese Input Method) is a Unix/Linux/BSD tool for typing in multiple scripts, so sorry this wouldn't be any use to Windows and Mac users.  That's why I'll only post if there's some interest.

As the Jerome version shows, the SCIM table includes a preliminary attempt at using senior forms.  Like most things in QS, this is a work in progress...
